paper_abstract: In this paper, we describe a way to compute accurate bounds on Jacobian determinants of curvilinear polynomial finite elements. Our condition enables to guarantee that an element is geometrically valid, i.e., that its Jacobian determinant is strictly positive everywhere in its reference domain. It also provides an efficient way to measure the distortion of curvilinear elements. The key feature of the method is to expand the Jacobian determinant using a polynomial basis, built using Bezier functions, that has both properties of boundedness and positivity. Numerical results show the sharpness of our estimates. (C) 2012 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Geometrical validity of curvilinear finite elements
